messages.message:
Hi team, how do I change aws keys in crafting? This (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YA1mqwNzrxFUN2m1hLT3-IooyJ6lPvShug76mL6A2Pg/edit?tab=t.0) is the context. The experience on local is:
1. Start all services with predefined aws keys in env-local-secrets in 1 pass
2. Put aws key id, access key, and token in env-local-secrets
3. Update namespace and region (see doc)
4. compile and restart api-server and celery-app-tasks
5. Create project, add validation function, see that creating a validation function succeeds
However, when i follow the steps on crafting and look at the api-server logs, I see that the keys are not being used correctly when creating a validation function udf in aihub (see :thread:  for error). I was wondering what the command to compile and restart would be such that the aws keys are reflected. My server is `sayanbhattacharjee1/dev`

```level=ERROR time=2025-01-08 22:42:11,492 msg="Uncaught exception in webserver while handling request: Error=An error occurred (UnrecognizedClientException) when calling the ListVersionsByFunction operation: The security token included in the request is invalid.```
@sean.donohoe @Paul H if yall have any knowledge on this
